title: 2013 Halloween event

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Ghostbusters event was released on 24 October 2013 as the 2013 Halloween event in Old School RuneScape. It was the 2006 Halloween event in RuneScape 3.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:2006 Hallowe'en event
2013 Halloween event
Please add an image!
Released 24 October 2013 (Update)
End date 7 November 2013 (Update)
Reward See below
Preceded by N/A
Succeeded by 2014 Halloween event

The Ghostbusters event was released on 24 October 2013 as the 2013 Halloween event in Old School RuneScape. It was the 2006 Halloween event in RuneScape 3.

Contents

  • 1 Walkthrough
    • 1.1 Starting off
    • 1.2 Busting ghosts
    • 1.3 The Haunted Tree
  • 2 Rewards
  • 3 Trivia

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Starting off[edit | edit source]

The location of Diango's workshop.

Players started the event by talking to Diango in Draynor Village. He then handed players an empty Ghost buster 500 with 50 rounds of white destabiliser and five lots of other, variously coloured destabilisers. His workshop was towards the north side of Draynor. The pixies Fionn and Cait will be at the ground floor of Diango's workshop (the building northeast of the red exclamation mark on the map); the pixies will be very frightened of the geists. Go inside the building, open the trap door, and proceed down the ladder.

Busting ghosts[edit | edit source]

A player dismisses a geist.

Once one entered Diango's Workshop, it became immediately apparent that tables, toy boatmen, wooden ducks, possessed puppets and creepy 'hand in box' toys had come to life. The toys and other such animated objects could not attack or hurt players, however the ghosts possessing them had been scaring the fairies, and as such had to leave. To rid a toy of its possessor, players simply had to load the Ghost buster 500 with the white destabiliser, which revealed the ghost's true identity. Shooting the first ghost would earn players the scared emote. Once the ghost's colour had been revealed, players had to shoot it with the correspondingly coloured destabiliser, which would send the ghost screaming back into the Underworld. Once busted, ghosts would stay busted, even if players left the workshop.

Colour Toy Geist Examine
Blue destabiliser A floating table Blue geist An otherwordly xylophone.
Red destabiliser Toy boatman Red geist From the deep he comes.
Yellow destabiliser Wooden ducks Yellow geist There's nothing scarier than wooden ducks.
Black destabiliser Possessed puppet Black geist This puppet has attitude.
Green destabiliser Hand in a box Green geist It's armed!

After busting 3 of a particular ghost colour, Diango would reward players with one of the five pieces of the Skeleton costume. Obtaining the full set required players to bust three of every coloured ghost. Diango would then take back the ghostbusting equipment.

The Haunted Tree[edit | edit source]

Chopping the roots underneath the workshop.

Diango also wanted players to rid his workshop of the tree in the middle. The best way to do that was to try attacking it from the inside, cutting out the roots which required an axe. Proceed to the same abandoned building in the north of Draynor Village, and you will find the pixies Cormac, Sorcha, Fionn, and Cait; all of whom are too frightened to talk. Open the trapdoor and proceed down the steps. There will be two ladders in close proximity to the trapdoor steps, take either ladder down to the basement, and go to the front of the tree. Pull up the large root in front of the tree and it will pull you down. You will see a bunch of hanging roots, which, if chopped, gives evil roots. Once you had chopped 10 evil roots, you could return to Diango to get your reward, a Jack lantern mask.

Rewards[edit | edit source]

A player wearing the Skeleton outfit.
A player wearing a Jack Lantern Mask.

The Skeleton outfit gives no bonus in any stats. Players had to banish different coloured ghosts in order to receive the costume. The costume consists of a mask, shirt, leggings, boots, and gloves. The Jack lantern mask was the second reward received from Diango. They have no bonuses either so they are purely for show.

• Skeleton mask
• Skeleton shirt
• Skeleton leggings
• Skeleton gloves
• Skeleton boots
• Jack lantern mask

In addition Diango rewarded players with a Scythe, a Zombie head, an untradeable Black h'ween mask and two noted Pumpkins, red, blue, and green h'ween masks and the Scared emote.

The rewards can be reclaimed from Diango in Draynor Village if lost or destroyed, and items may be stored in the costume room of your house.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • This event is based on the Ghostbusters movie, having similar elements and referencing the movie in a number of quotes. For example, when talking to Diango, he asks 'Who am I gonna call?' and your character would reply 'Me! I ain't afraid of no ghost!' Also, when given the explanation on how to use the Ghost buster 500, Diango would warn "Whatever you do, don't cross the streams!"

{{External|rs=2006 Hallowe'en event}} {{Infobox Event |name = 2013 Halloween event |image = |release = [[24 October]] [[2013]] |update = Halloween & Death Mechanics |removal = [[7 November]] [[2013]] |removalupdate = POH updates & weapon tweaks |reward = [[#Rewards|See below]] |succeeded = [[2014 Halloween event]] }} The '''Ghostbusters event''' was released on [[24 October]] [[2013]] as the 2013 Halloween event in ''[[Old School RuneScape]]''. It was the [[rsw:2006 Halloween event|2006 Halloween event]] in ''RuneScape 3''. ==Walkthrough== ===Starting off=== [[File:Diango chathead.png|left]] [[File:Diango's Workshop location.png|right|thumb|180px|The location of Diango's workshop.]] Players started the event by talking to Diango in [[Draynor Village]]. He then handed players an empty [[Ghost buster 500]] with 50 rounds of white destabiliser and five lots of other, variously coloured destabilisers. His workshop was towards the north side of Draynor. The pixies Fionn and Cait will be at the ground floor of Diango's workshop (the building northeast of the red exclamation mark on the map); the pixies will be very frightened of the geists. Go inside the building, open the trap door, and proceed down the ladder. ===Busting ghosts=== [[File:Dismissing geist.gif|frame|left|A player dismisses a geist.]] Once one entered Diango's Workshop, it became immediately apparent that tables, toy boatmen, wooden ducks, possessed puppets and creepy 'hand in box' toys had come to life. The toys and other such animated objects could not attack or hurt players, however the ghosts possessing them had been scaring the fairies, and as such had to leave. To rid a toy of its possessor, players simply had to load the Ghost buster 500 with the white destabiliser, which revealed the ghost's true identity. Shooting the first ghost would earn players the scared emote. Once the ghost's colour had been revealed, players had to shoot it with the correspondingly coloured destabiliser, which would send the ghost screaming back into the Underworld. Once busted, ghosts would stay busted, even if players left the workshop. {{Clear|left}} {| class="wikitable" !Colour !Toy !Geist !Examine |- |{{Plink|Blue destabiliser}} |[[File:A floating table.png|50px]] [[A floating table]] |[[File:Blue geist.png|50px]] [[Blue geist]] |An otherwordly xylophone. |- |{{Plink|Red destabiliser}} |[[File:Toy boatman.png|50px]] [[Toy boatman]] |[[File:Red geist.png|50px]] [[Red geist]] |From the deep he comes. |- |{{Plink|Yellow destabiliser}} |[[File:Wooden ducks.png|50px]] [[Wooden ducks]] |[[File:Yellow geist.png|50px]] [[Yellow geist]] |There's nothing scarier than wooden ducks. |- |{{Plink|Black destabiliser}} |[[File:Possessed puppet.png|30px]] [[Possessed puppet]] |[[File:Black geist.png|50px]] [[Black geist]] |This puppet has attitude. |- |{{Plink|Green destabiliser}} |[[File:Hand in a box.png|50px]] [[Hand in a box]] |[[File:Green geist.png|50px]] [[Green geist]] |It's armed! |} After busting 3 of a particular ghost colour, Diango would reward players with one of the five pieces of the [[Skeleton outfit|Skeleton costume]]. Obtaining the full set required players to bust three of every coloured ghost. Diango would then take back the ghostbusting equipment. ===The Haunted Tree=== [[File:Chopping evil roots.png|thumb|Chopping the roots underneath the workshop.]] Diango also wanted players to rid his workshop of the tree in the middle. The best way to do that was to try attacking it from the inside, cutting out the roots which required an [[axe]]. Proceed to the same abandoned building in the north of Draynor Village, and you will find the pixies Cormac, Sorcha, Fionn, and Cait; all of whom are too frightened to talk. Open the trapdoor and proceed down the steps. There will be two ladders in close proximity to the trapdoor steps, take either ladder down to the basement, and go to the front of the tree. Pull up the large root in front of the tree and it will pull you down. You will see a bunch of hanging roots, which, if chopped, gives [[evil root]]s. Once you had chopped 10 evil roots, you could return to Diango to get your reward, a [[Jack lantern mask]]. {{clear|right}} ==Rewards==
[[File:Skeleton outfit equipped.png|thumb|right|x280px|A player wearing the Skeleton outfit.]] [[File:Jack lantern mask equipped.png|thumb|left|x280px|A player wearing a Jack Lantern Mask.]]
The [[Skeleton outfit]] gives no bonus in any stats. Players had to banish different coloured ghosts in order to receive the costume. The costume consists of a mask, shirt, leggings, boots, and gloves. The [[Jack lantern mask]] was the second reward received from Diango. They have no bonuses either so they are purely for show. {| class="align-center-2" |{{*}}||{{plinkt|Skeleton mask}} |- |{{*}}||{{plinkt|Skeleton shirt}} |- |{{*}}||{{plinkt|Skeleton leggings}} |- |{{*}}||{{plinkt|Skeleton gloves}} |- |{{*}}||{{plinkt|Skeleton boots}} |- |{{*}}||{{plinkt|Jack lantern mask}} |} In addition Diango rewarded players with a [[Scythe]], a [[Zombie head]], an untradeable [[Black h'ween mask]] and two noted [[Pumpkin]]s, [[Red h'ween mask|red]], [[Blue h'ween mask|blue]], and [[Green h'ween mask|green]] h'ween masks and the [[Scared]] emote. The rewards can be reclaimed from Diango in Draynor Village if lost or destroyed, and items may be stored in the costume room of your [[Player-owned house|house]]. ==Trivia== *This event is based on the ''[[Wikipedia:Ghostbusters|Ghostbusters]]'' movie, having similar elements and referencing the movie in a number of quotes. For example, when talking to Diango, he asks 'Who am I gonna call?' and your character would reply 'Me! I ain't afraid of no ghost!' Also, when given the explanation on how to use the Ghost buster 500, Diango would warn "Whatever you do, don't cross the streams!" {{2013 Halloween event}} {{Events}}
